item.title: Pokemon TCG Pocket Mythical Island Expansion Adds 80 Cards, Including One That Turns Off Evolutions
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gamespot.com/articles/pokemon-tcg-pocket-mythical-island-expansion-adds-80-cards-including-one-that-turns-off-evolutions/1100-6528407/?ftag=CAD-01-10abi2f

GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

With over 60 million downloads reported so far, Pokemon TCG Pocket is proving to be another smash-hit mobile game for Pikachu and his thousands of Pokemon pals. Those 60 million people have only had one set to work with--until next week, when the first expansion Mythical adds 80 new cards on December 17.

Mew is the featured Pokemon on the packs of this new expansion, which will also offer new binder and display-cover options. Other cards teased in the expansion's reveal trailer are foil-bordered versions of Tauros, Supporter cards for Blue and Lass, and alternate art versions of Marshadow, Vaporeon, and Dedenne.

Two EX cards have also been revealed for the Mythical Island expansion: Mew EX and Aerodactyl EX. Their abilities are as follows:

  • Mew EX (Psychic Type)
    • 130 HP, retreat cost 1 Colorless energy
    • Attack 1: Psyshot (Requires one Psychic energy, deals 20 damage)
    • Attack 2: Genome Hacking (requires three Colorless energy)
      • Choose 1 of your opponent's Active Pokemon's attacks and use it as this attack.
  • Aerodactyl EX (Fighting Type, evolves from Old Amber)
    • 140 HP, retreat cost 1 Colorless energy
    • Ability: Primeval Law
      • Your opponent can't play any Pokemon from their hand to evolve their Active Pokemon.
    • Attack: Land Crush (Requires one Colorless and one Fighting energy, deals 80 damage)

Pokemon Trading Card Game Pocket launched October 30 on iOS and Android devices, where it offers a new way to experience the Pokemon TCG, which originally launched in America in January 1999. Players can open free packs of cards daily, then use those cards to build decks and battle opponents in a streamlined version of the physical card game.

Jason Fanelli on Google+

Got a news tip or want to contact us directly? Email news@gamespot.com

item.title: Assassin's Creed Shadows' Canon Mode Can Make All Of The Big Choices For You
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gamespot.com/articles/assassins-creed-shadows-canon-mode-can-make-all-of-the-big-choices-for-you/1100-6528401/?ftag=CAD-01-10abi2f

GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

Player choices have been a big part of the Assassin's Creed franchise, and that's still going to be true in Assassin's Creed Shadows. However, for any fans who don't want to agonize over which branching dialogue option to pick or who to romance, Ubisoft is introducing a new canon mode in Shadows that will let the players simply experience the story without having to make any choices of their own.

Shadows director Jonathan Dumont revealed the new option during a Reddit appearance alongside other developers from the game.

"Choices come more into play when recruiting allies and [romancing] some of the characters," said Dumont. "Since the fan base is divided on branching dialogues, we have incorporated an option called Canon Mode which allows you to play the game with choices already made for you, to give you a choice-free experience. Hope this makes it fun for everyone."

Dumont also noted that Shadows is close to Assassin's Creed Origins in terms of scale. Associate Narrative Director Brooke Davies added that the two main characters, Naoe and Yasuke, can pick their preferred romantic partners outside of Canon Mode for both "shorter and longer romance opportunities." She also said, "The story of Shadows culminates in a single, [canonical] ending. That said there are many unique paths leading to this point, and in particular that will determine who is (and isn't) at your side along the way."

The developers confirmed that Shadows will introduce a new direction for the modern-day storyline. Dumont indicated that Shadows "will be different than what we have done in the past, but that is connected to our modern-day lore and will develop over time in the Animus Hub and subsequent titles." He also said that Hattori Hanz≈ç from Assassin's Creed: Memories will appear in Shadows.

Additionally, Davies indicated that Naoe and Yasuke won't immediately be on the same side.

"Their paths do ultimately converge and we see them form a league together around common cause," said Davies. "That said, this path is not always smooth and straight, and their unique backgrounds and perspectives do not always align. This is something we will see them and sometimes even help them to work through by making some interesting choices."

Ubisoft recently shared a lengthy overview of how combat will work in Shadows. Details about the game's battle pass have leaked online, and Ubisoft has stated that the rewards in the Animus Hub are free. Assassin's Creed Shadows will hit PlayStation 5, Xbox Series X|S, and PC on February 14, 2025.

Got a news tip or want to contact us directly? Email news@gamespot.com

item.title: No Past Black Ops Map Is Off The Table For A Remaster, Says Call Of Duty Dev
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gamespot.com/articles/no-past-black-ops-map-is-off-the-table-for-a-remaster-says-call-of-duty-dev/1100-6528400/?ftag=CAD-01-10abi2f

GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

Call of Duty: Black Ops 6 Season 1 had an unexpected surprise for players when it brought back the Hacienda map from Call of Duty: Black Ops 4, and it may not be the only classic map to get a remaster. During a recent interview, Treyarch's Associate Creative Director Miles Leslie hinted that the team already has its favorite maps to revisit, and no map is off the table.

"We put a ton of consideration into the prospective remasters with each new game," Leslie told Dextero. "We know there are certain fan favorites that players would like to see again, and we have some of our own favorites that we've had on a wish list over the years. I'll just say that while we're still focused on delivering original designs as the majority of our post-launch maps, no previous Black Ops title is off the table for potential remasters."

Earlier this month, a Call of Duty leaker reported that the Launch map from Call of Duty: Black Ops 1 will return with a new title, Cosmodome, in either Black Ops 6 or the next Call of Duty game that's coming in 2025. This rumor has yet to be confirmed.

Prior to the launch of Season 1, Treyarch laid out everything players can expect to see in Black Ops 6. The developer also revealed that a free trial for Black Ops 6's multiplayer and Zombies modes will begin on December 13 for a limited time. Players also recently discovered a game-ending Easter egg in Black Ops 6's Nuketown. Additionally, Treyarch teased a collaboration between Black Ops 6 and Netflix's Squid Game.

Got a news tip or want to contact us directly? Email news@gamespot.com
